alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Middlesex; New Haven (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 21 at 7:28PM EDT until July 21 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL FAIRFIELD...SOUTHERN MIDDLESEX AND SOUTHEASTERN NEW HAVEN COUNTIES... At 728 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Killingworth to near Branford to near Milford, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. These severe storms will be near... Killingworth and North Madison around 735 PM EDT. Westbrook around 740 PM EDT. Chester around 745 PM EDT. Clinton around 750 PM EDT. Old Saybrook around 755 PM EDT. Old Lyme around 805 PM EDT. Lyme around 810 PM EDT. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
